articles.description: SEATTLE -- On seven occasions on Friday at T-Mobile Park, a Pirate stepped into the batter’s box, waved his baton -- or bat, rather -- and orchestrated an entire stadium full of groans. Andrew McCutchen played that role of conductor, as did Carlos Santana, Ja…

articles.author: Derrick Goold
articles.title: Cleveland guards against Cardinals' late-inning comeback tries, keeps middle order quiet - St. Louis Post-Dispatch
articles.description: Matthew Liberatore allows all four runs in one fifth-inning burst as Guardians hold tight for 4-3 victory Friday. Cardinals cannot capitalize in final four innings.
articles.content:
Gift this article
CLEVELAND All of the offense the Cleveland Guardians generated in a single bound was too much for the Cardinals to match despite chance after chance after chance.
